column3: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.

Everything great in science and art is simple. What can be less complicated than the greatest discoveries of humanity - gravitation, the compass, the printing press, the steam engine, the electric telegraph?

'Summer of Love: Art of the Psychedelic Era,' the Whitney Museum's 40th-anniversary trip down counterculture memory lane, provides moments of buzzy fun, but it'll leave you only comfortably numb. For starters, it may be the whitest, straightest, most conservative show seen in a New York museum since psychedelia was new.
A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
It is more important to click with people than to click the shutter.
We are only beginning to learn what to say in a photograph. The world we live in is a succession of fleeting moments, any one of which might say something significant.
Art is a revolt against fate. All art is a revolt against man's fate.
One's art goes as far and as deep as one's love goes.
There is nothing new in art except talent.

The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.
Every artist was first an amateur.
I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
The job of the artist is always to deepen the mystery.
Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
I don't understand it. Jack will spend any amount of money to buy votes but he balks at investing a thousand dollars in a beautiful painting.
What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.
Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.

When I am finishing a picture, I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it's bad art.
The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
All art is dependent on technology because it's a human endeavour, so even when you're using charcoal on a wall or designed the proscenium arch, that's technology.
When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.
Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal.
